summary_reasoning: The report exhibits solid analytical depth by linking drivers to outcomes and embedding explicit, quantified assumptions. It explains causality across segments—data center AI strength offsetting wireless/EV softness—and ties orders to future revenue (“orders exceeded revenue”), indicating forward momentum. Mechanisms are clearly articulated, such as margin expansion via software/services (“mix tilting toward software and services to expand margins”) and quantified external headwinds (“gross tariff impact at about $100 million”). Forecasts are explicit by segment and long term (“We forecast 6% growth… midcycle”), and the DCF lays out key parameters (“WACC … 8.7%”). Assumptions are partially benchmarked using market share and peer positioning (e.g., 25% overall T&M share; 75% of 5G designs; R&D level relative to peers), supporting the moat and margin narrative. Counterpoints are addressed (wireless/automotive softness, M&A execution risk), though scenario/sensitivity analysis is not quantified. Actionable implications are present through a maintained fair value and clear conditions for recovery (AI/wired strength, expected wireless/industrial rebound). Strongest quotes: “AI continues to drive growth”; “gross tariff impact at about $100 million”; “orders exceeded revenue”; “We forecast 6% growth… midcycle”; “WACC … 8.7%”.

missing_mechanisms: how mitigation achieves 'fully mitigate' tariffs not detailed
unsupported_assumptions: Stage II EBI growth rate 10% without industry benchmark
WACC 8.7% not justified vs peer capital costs
lack_of_sensitivity: no quantified ranges on margin expansion or segment growth
